direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve comparing objects, though 'compare' is for ordering and 'equals' is for equality.
Both methods are part of the standard Java object contract for equality and hash code generation, sharing similar control flows and exception handling.
The 'isLocked' method affects the behavior of 'equals' by determining if modifications to the comparator are allowed.
The 'setUnknownObjectBehavior' method can influence the behavior of 'equals' by changing how unknown objects are handled.
The 'getUnknownObjectBehavior' method retrieves the behavior setting that can affect how 'equals' handles unknown objects.
